author: Habib Khan Totakhil
title: Afghan Security Forces Blockade Vice President’s Home Over Assault Charges - WSJ
text:
Afghan Security Forces Blockade Vice President’s Home Over Assault Charges Authorities want to question Abdul Rashid Dostum over assault claims by a political rival By ehsanullah.amirii Feb. 21, 2017 1:38 p.m. ET 
KABUL—Afghan security forces blockaded the country’s vice president inside his residence in the capital on Tuesday in a bid to compel him to cooperate with an investigation into charges that he and nine bodyguards kidnapped and sexually assaulted a rival. 
The move by Afghan authorities against the vice president, Abdul Rashid Dostum, raised fears of violence between government security forces and Mr. Dostum’s personal militia in the... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
